genre: Space Opera / Family Saga / Soap Opera

setting.primary_location: The Hegemony - a network of 7 star systems connected by Jump Gates
setting.atmosphere: Opulent yet decaying; political intrigue meets family drama across the stars
key_locations: Celestia Prime - Capital station orbiting a blue supergiant; home of the ruling Council
New Versailles - Luxury orbital palace of the Ashford dynasty
The Obsidian - Mining station in the Kuiper Belt; working class hub
Meridian Colony - Agricultural planet; breadbasket of the Hegemony
The Nexus - Massive Jump Gate hub station controlling all inter-system travel
Cygnus Shipyards - Massive construction facility; military and commercial
Elysium - Resort moon; playground of the ultra-wealthy

faster_than_light_travel.method: Jump Gates only - massive structures connecting star systems
faster_than_light_travel.limitations: Only 7 systems connected; gates controlled by the Transit Authority (de facto most powerful entity)
faster_than_light_travel.jump_time: Instantaneous through gate, but weeks of travel to reach gates from planets
faster_than_light_travel.restriction: Gate access can be denied, effectively isolating entire systems

life_extension.longevity_treatments: Available only to the wealthy; can extend life to 150-200 years
life_extension.cost: Requires rare element 'Chronium' mined from asteroids
life_extension.side_effects: Cognitive rigidity increases; old grudges literally last lifetimes
life_extension.inequality: Creates generational divide - the old refuse to die, the young can't rise

genetic_engineering.legal_status: Legal for disease prevention; illegal for enhancement
genetic_engineering.black_market: Thriving underground enhancement trade creates 'perfect children' with unknown heritage
genetic_engineering.identification: Gene-scanning can reveal parentage, creating scandal opportunities
genetic_engineering.designer_children: Some elite families secretly use it, creating succession controversies

artificial_intelligence.status: Banned after the AI Wars of 2847
artificial_intelligence.exception: Limited VI (Virtual Intelligence) allowed for ship navigation and life support
artificial_intelligence.punishment: Creating true AI is capital offense
artificial_intelligence.underground: Rumors of hidden AI in the outer systems fuel paranoia

social_structures: The Seven Families - dynasties controlling each star system (like medieval kingdoms)
Transit Authority - controls Jump Gates; neutral but holds ultimate power
The Council - representatives from each family; endless political maneuvering
Corporate Houses - merchant families; nouveau riche challenging old aristocracy
The Working Caste - miners, farmers, station workers; growing unrest
The Unbound - spacers who reject family allegiance; pirates, smugglers, free traders

marriage_and_inheritance.marriage: Political tools; arranged marriages between families to secure alliances
marriage_and_inheritance.legitimacy: Only legitimate heirs can inherit titles and system control
marriage_and_inheritance.scandal: Illegitimate children create endless drama and succession crises
marriage_and_inheritance.divorce: Forbidden - marriages are lifetime contracts enforced by the Council
marriage_and_inheritance.annulment: Possible but requires Council vote; politically devastating

economy.key_resources: Chronium (life extension), Helium-3 (fusion power), Rare earths (technology)
economy.monopolies: Each family controls resources in their system
economy.trade: Dependent on Jump Gates; Transit Authority takes 30% tax on all trade

themes: Legacy vs Progress - the old refuse to die, blocking the young from power
Love vs Duty - personal desires constantly clash with family obligations
Truth and Secrets - hidden parentage, secret deals, buried scandals across generations
Power and Corruption - absolute power across star systems corrupts absolutely
Unity vs Division - the Hegemony fractures and reunites repeatedly over 100 years
tone: Epic yet intimate - grand space opera scale with focus on personal relationships, betrayals, and family drama. Lush descriptions of orbital palaces and space stations. Emotional intensity of soap opera with consequences that span decades and generations.
narrative_structure: Each book covers ~10 years. Early books focus on individual characters; later books follow their children and grandchildren. Generational saga where sins of parents echo through time.

core_conflicts.political: The Seven Families vie for control of the Council and Transit Authority
core_conflicts.social: Growing class warfare between aristocracy and working caste
core_conflicts.economic: Resource scarcity creates desperate measures and moral compromises
core_conflicts.personal: Love triangles, secret parentage, betrayals, revenge plots spanning decades
core_conflicts.technological: Temptation to use banned AI and illegal genetic engineering for advantage
